  • Constructor Details

    • ApplicationServer

      public ApplicationServer​(int port, java.lang.String outputFilePath)
      ApplicationServer constructor: creates a SocketServer on the indicated port
      Parameters:
      port - server port
      outputFilePath - log file relative path

  • Method Details

    • waitClient

      public void waitClient()
      Wait connection from clients. Following a connection, it reads what is sent through the Socket, recreates the Command object sent by the client, and will call treatCommand(Command command)

    • treatCommand

      public java.lang.Object treatCommand​(Command command)
      Takes a Command, and process it. Depending on the Command type, it calls the specified method
      Parameters:
      command - takes a Command send by the client
      Returns:
      the result of the executed Command

    • treatCompilation

      public java.lang.String treatCompilation​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> sourceFilesList, java.lang.String outDirectoryPath)
      Treats the compilation of a java source file. Confirms to the client that the compilation was done correctly. The source file is given by its relative path.
      Parameters:
      sourceFilesList - list of source files to compile
      outDirectoryPath - path of the output directory
      Returns:
      "0" if the compilation is correctly done, else returns another number

    • treatLoad

      public java.lang.String treatLoad​(java.lang.String classPackage, java.lang.String outClassesDirectory)
      Treats the loading of a class. Confirms to the client that the creation was done correctly.
      Parameters:
      classPackage - qualified class name (ex: classes.Student)
      outClassesDirectory - relative path of the output directory for .class files
      Returns:
      "Successfully loading..." if class loading is correctly done, else return an error message

    • treatCreate

      public java.lang.Object treatCreate​(java.lang.Class<?> objectClass, java.lang.String objectId)
      Treats the creation of an object. Confirms to the customer that the creation was done correctly.
      Parameters:
      objectClass - the class for the object that you want to instantiate
      objectId - the id for the object that you want to create
      Returns:
      "Successfully creating..." if creation is correctly done, else returns an error message

    • treatRead

      public java.lang.Object treatRead​(java.lang.Object objectPointer, java.lang.String attribute)
      Treats reading of an attribute. Return the result by the socket
      Parameters:
      objectPointer - pointer on the object that you want you to read the attribute
      attribute - the attribute name that you want to read
      Returns:
      the value of the attribute, else returns an error message

    • treatWrite

      public java.lang.Object treatWrite​(java.lang.Object objectPointer, java.lang.String attribute, java.lang.Object value)
      Treats writing of an attribute. Confirms to the customer that the entry was done correctly
      Parameters:
      objectPointer - pointer on the object that you want you to write the attribute
      attribute - the attribute name that you want to write
      value - the value that you want to write
      Returns:
      "Successfully writing..." if the entry is correctly done, else returns an error message

    • treatCall

      public java.lang.Object treatCall​(java.lang.Object objectPointer, java.lang.String functionName, java.lang.String[] types, java.lang.Object[] argValues)
      Treats the call of a method. Confirms to the client if the call was correctly done or not.
      Parameters:
      objectPointer - the pointer on the object on which the call is made
      functionName - the name of the function to call
      types - an array of arguments types names
      argValues - an array of arguments for the function (corresponding the types array)
      Returns:
      the return of the called function, else returns an error message if the function not exist

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main Program Take 4 args: 1. Server port 2. General sources repertory 3. Classes repertory 4. Output file path This method creates an instance of ApplicationServer class, initialize it and then wait clients
      Parameters:
      args - arguments of the main program

    • printCorrectUsageAndExit

      public static void printCorrectUsageAndExit()
      Prints correct program arguments usage
